Posts.Content: Sep 10, 2008 10:51PM CorasMama wrote: Hey! Here's something I didn't expect! The lidocaine (which I know doesn't work very well for me, so I'd asked them to load me up) WORE OFF HALFWAY THROUGH! Gee, that was fun! The doctor's all, "No, you're just feeling a lot of pressure." And I'm like, "No, I WAS feeling a lot of pressure. NOW I'm feeling you're air-fired huge-effing needle shooting into my boob and drilling out chunks of breast tissue."
Posts.Title: Core Biopsy w/ U/S, what to expect? CorasMama Jo_Ann_K

Posts.Content: Oct 7, 2008 01:30AM CorasMama wrote: I had my MRI on a Wednesday, and had my report (full report, not preliminary) Friday afternoon. A lot of times, they'll give your doctor your report, without even telling you. So get on top of your doctor on that.
Posts.Title: How soon should I get MRI results? goldendragonlady lovinmomma

Posts.Content: CorasMama wrote: I'm having a core biopsy (NOT a fine needle biopsy) using ultrasound, on Wednesday. (For those of you who read my previous thread, the tech got sick, and it's been rescheduled for Weds.) I want to know what to expect. How much will it hurt? How much will the lidocaine shots hurt, and how deep do they go? How deep does the core needle (is that what it's called) go? Do they insert the core needle more than once, and in more than one place? Will it hurt when the lidocaine wears off? How much, compared to, say, dental work? Will I have a bandage over it, or just a bandaid? For how long? Will it scar? Thank you. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Core Biopsy w/ U/S, what to expect? CorasMama Jo_Ann_K

Posts.Content: CorasMama wrote: We're trying to have a baby, and I'm in my mid-30s, so it isn't as easy as it was in my early 20s! I'm concerned about the idea of taking supplements or meds that mess with hormones. I think that what I don't want is something that increases estrogen or has estrogen-like qualities (so no non-fermented soy!) But I don't know what clomid, femara, and vitex do. Any advice/links/resources? Log in to post a reply

How do I do this??? Are there local message boards? I'm completely at a loss.
